content.question: Which of the following requires the use of implicit differentiation to find <math alttext="the derivative of y, with respect to x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mi>d</mi><mi>y</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>d</mi><mi>x</mi></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math> ?

choices.label: <math alttext="y minus, x squared, minus 3 x, plus 5, equals 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mi>y</mi><mo>−</mo><msup><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><mo>−</mo><mn>3</mn><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>5</mn><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="y equals, the natural log of open parenthesis, 3 plus x, close parenthesis, plus x squared" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mi>y</mi><mo>=</mo><mi>ln</mi><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mn>3</mn><mo>+</mo><mi>x</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo><mo>+</mo><msup><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="y equals, the natural log of open parenthesis, y plus x, close parenthesis, plus x squared" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mi>y</mi><mo>=</mo><mi>ln</mi><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>y</mi><mo>+</mo><mi>x</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo><mo>+</mo><msup><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="y equals, the fraction with numerator x cubed, minus 4, and denominator 3 x, plus 2, end fraction" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mi>y</mi><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msup><mo>−</mo><mn>4</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>2</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="y equals, the natural log of open parenthesis, y plus x, close parenthesis, plus x squared" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mi>y</mi><mo>=</mo><mi>ln</mi><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>y</mi><mo>+</mo><mi>x</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo><mo>+</mo><msup><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>

unit.text: 3: Differentiation: Composite, Implicit, and Inverse Functions

skill.text: Skill 1.C: Identify an appropriate mathematical rule or procedure based on the classification of a given expression (e.g., Use the chain rule to find the derivative of a composite function).
